026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool;

028import java.io.File;
029import java.io.IOException;
030import java.io.PrintWriter;
031import java.text.BreakIterator;
032import java.text.Collator;

073/**
074 * Main program of Javadoc.
075 * Previously named "Main".
076 */
077public class Start {
078
079    /** Context for this invocation. */
080    private final Context context;
081
082    private static final String ProgramName = "javadoc";
083
084    private JavadocLog log;
085
086    private final String docletName;
087
088    private final ClassLoader classLoader;
089
090    private Class<?> docletClass;
091
092    private Doclet doclet;
093
094    // used to determine the locale for the log
095    private Locale locale;
096
097    /**
098     * In API mode, exceptions thrown while calling the doclet are
099     * propagated using ClientCodeException.
100     */
101    private boolean apiMode;
102
103    private JavaFileManager fileManager;
104
105    private final ToolOptions options;
106
107    Start() {
108        this(null, null, null, null, null, null);
109    }
110
111    Start(PrintWriter outWriter, PrintWriter errWriter) {
112        this(null, null, outWriter, errWriter, null, null);
113    }
114
115    Start(Context context, String programName,
116            PrintWriter outWriter, PrintWriter errWriter,
117            String docletName, ClassLoader classLoader) {
118        this.context = context == null ? new Context() : context;
119        String pname = programName == null ? ProgramName : programName;
120        this.log = (outWriter == null && errWriter == null)
121            ? new JavadocLog(this.context, pname)
122            : new JavadocLog(this.context, pname, outWriter, errWriter);
123        this.docletName = docletName;
124        this.classLoader = classLoader;
125        this.docletClass = null;
126        this.locale = Locale.getDefault();
127
128        options = getToolOptions();
129    }
130
131    public Start(Context context) {
132        this.docletClass = null;
133        this.context = Objects.requireNonNull(context);
134        this.apiMode = true;
135        this.docletName = null;
136        this.classLoader = null;
137        this.locale = Locale.getDefault();
138
139        Log log = context.get(Log.logKey);
140        if (log instanceof JavadocLog l) {
141            this.log = l;
142        } else {
143            PrintWriter out = context.get(Log.errKey);
144            this.log = (out == null)
145                ? new JavadocLog(context, ProgramName)
146                : new JavadocLog(context, ProgramName, out, out);
147        }
148
149        options = getToolOptions();
150    }
151
152    private ToolOptions getToolOptions() {
153        ToolOptions.ShowHelper helper = new ToolOptions.ShowHelper() {
154            @Override
155            public void usage() {
156                showUsage("main.usage", ToolOption.Kind.STANDARD,
157                    "main.usage.foot");
158            }
159
160            @Override
161            public void Xusage() {
162                showUsage("main.Xusage", ToolOption.Kind.EXTENDED,
163                    "main.Xusage.foot");
164            }
165
166            @Override
167            public void version() {
168                showVersion("javadoc.version", orDefault(
169                    () -> Versions.shortVersionStringOf(toolVersion())));
170            }
171
172            @Override
173            public void fullVersion() {
174                showVersion("javadoc.fullversion", orDefault(
175                    () -> Versions.fullVersionStringOf(toolVersion())));
176            }
177
178            private String orDefault(Supplier<String> s) {
179                try {
180                    return s.get();
181                } catch (RuntimeException e) {
182                    assert false : e;
183                    return Log.getLocalizedString("version.not.available");
184                }
185            }
186        };
187        return new ToolOptions(context, log, helper);
188    }
189
190    private Runtime.Version toolVersion() {
191        return Versions.javadocVersion();
192    }
193
194    private void showUsage() {
195        showUsage("main.usage", ToolOption.Kind.STANDARD, "main.usage.foot");
196    }
197
198    private void showUsage(String headerKey, ToolOption.Kind kind,
199            String footerKey) {
200        showLinesUsingKey(headerKey);
201        showToolOptions(kind);
202
203        // let doclet print usage information
204        if (docletClass != null) {
205            showDocletOptions(kind == ToolOption.Kind.EXTENDED
206                ? Option.Kind.EXTENDED
207                : Option.Kind.STANDARD);
208        }
209        if (footerKey != null) {
210            showLinesUsingKey(footerKey);
211        }
212    }
213
214    private void showVersion(String labelKey, String value) {
215        showLinesUsingKey(labelKey, log.programName, value);
216    }
217
218    private void showToolOptions(ToolOption.Kind kind) {
219        var comp = new Comparator<ToolOption>() {
220            final Collator collator = Collator.getInstance(Locale.US);
221            {
222                collator.setStrength(Collator.PRIMARY);
223            }
224
225            @Override
226            public int compare(ToolOption o1, ToolOption o2) {
227                return collator.compare(o1.primaryName, o2.primaryName);
228            }
229        };
230
231        options.getSupportedOptions().stream()
232            .filter(opt -> opt.kind == kind)
233            .sorted(comp)
234            .forEach(this::showToolOption);
235    }
236
237    private void showToolOption(ToolOption option) {
238        List<String> names = option.getNames();
239        String primaryName = option.primaryName;
240        String parameters;
241        if (option.hasArg || primaryName.endsWith(":")) {
242            String sep = primaryName.endsWith(":")
243                || primaryName.equals(ToolOptions.AT)
244                || primaryName.equals(ToolOptions.J)
245                    ? ""
246                    : " ";
247            parameters = sep + option.getParameters(log);
248        } else {
249            parameters = "";
250        }
251        String description = option.getDescription(log);
252        showOption(names, parameters, description);
253    }
254
255    private void showDocletOptions(Option.Kind kind) {
256        String name = doclet.getName();
257        Set<? extends Option> options = getSupportedOptionsOf(doclet);
258        if (options.isEmpty()) {
259            return;
260        }
261        showLinesUsingKey("main.doclet.usage.header", name);
262
263        var comp = new Comparator<Doclet.Option>() {
264            final Collator collator = Collator.getInstance(Locale.US);
265            {
266                collator.setStrength(Collator.PRIMARY);
267            }
268
269            @Override
270            public int compare(Doclet.Option o1, Doclet.Option o2) {
271                return collator.compare(o1.getNames().get(0),
272                    o2.getNames().get(0));
273            }
274        };
275
276        options.stream()
277            .filter(opt -> opt.getKind() == kind)
278            .sorted(comp)
279            .forEach(this::showDocletOption);
280    }
281
282    private void showDocletOption(Doclet.Option option) {
283        List<String> names = option.getNames();
284        String parameters;
285        String primaryName = names.get(0);
286        if (option.getArgumentCount() > 0 || primaryName.endsWith(":")) {
287            String sep = primaryName.endsWith(":") ? "" : " ";
288            parameters = sep + option.getParameters();
289        } else {
290            parameters = "";
291        }
292        String description = option.getDescription();
293        showOption(names, parameters, description);
294    }
295
296    // The following constants are intended to format the output to
297    // be similar to that of the java launcher: i.e. "java -help".
298
299    /** The indent for the option synopsis. */
300    private static final String SMALL_INDENT = " ".repeat(4);
301    /** The automatic indent for the description. */
302    private static final String LARGE_INDENT = " ".repeat(18);
303    /** The space allowed for the synopsis, if the description is to be shown on the same line. */
304    private static final int DEFAULT_SYNOPSIS_WIDTH = 13;
305    /** The nominal maximum line length, when seeing if text will fit on a line. */
306    private static final int DEFAULT_MAX_LINE_LENGTH = 80;
307    /** The format for a single-line help entry. */
308    private static final String COMPACT_FORMAT
309        = SMALL_INDENT + "%-" + DEFAULT_SYNOPSIS_WIDTH + "s %s";
310
311    void showOption(List<String> names, String parameters, String description) {
312        String synopses = names.stream()
313            .map(s -> s + parameters)
314            .collect(Collectors.joining(", "));
315        // If option synopses and description fit on a single line of reasonable
316        // length,
317        // display using COMPACT_FORMAT
318        if (synopses.length() < DEFAULT_SYNOPSIS_WIDTH
319            && !description.contains("\n")
320            && (SMALL_INDENT.length() + DEFAULT_SYNOPSIS_WIDTH + 1
321                + description.length() <= DEFAULT_MAX_LINE_LENGTH)) {
322            showLines(String.format(COMPACT_FORMAT, synopses, description));
323            return;
324        }
325
326        // If option synopses fit on a single line of reasonable length, show
327        // that;
328        // otherwise, show 1 per line
329        if (synopses.length() <= DEFAULT_MAX_LINE_LENGTH) {
330            showLines(SMALL_INDENT + synopses);
331        } else {
332            for (String name : names) {
333                showLines(SMALL_INDENT + name + parameters);
334            }
335        }
336
337        // Finally, show the description
338        showLines(
339            LARGE_INDENT + description.replace("\n", "\n" + LARGE_INDENT));
340    }
341
342    private void showLinesUsingKey(String key, Object... args) {
343        showLines(log.getText(key, args));
344    }
345
346    private void showLines(String message) {
347        log.printRawLines(Log.WriterKind.STDOUT, message);
348    }
349
350    /**
351     * Main program - external wrapper.
352     */
353    @SuppressWarnings("deprecation")
354    Result begin(String... argv) {
355        // Preprocess @file arguments
356        List<String> allArgs;
357        try {
358            allArgs = CommandLine.parse(List.of(argv));
359        } catch (IOException e) {
360            error("main.cant.read", e.getMessage());
361            return ERROR;
362        }
363        return begin(allArgs, Set.of());
364    }
365
366    // Called by the JSR 199 API
367    public boolean begin(Class<?> docletClass,
368            Iterable<String> options,
369            Iterable<? extends JavaFileObject> fileObjects) {
370        this.docletClass = docletClass;
371        List<String> opts = new ArrayList<>();
372        for (String opt : options)
373            opts.add(opt);
374
375        return begin(opts, fileObjects).isOK();
376    }
377
378    private Result begin(List<String> options,
379            Iterable<? extends JavaFileObject> fileObjects) {
380        fileManager = context.get(JavaFileManager.class);
381        if (fileManager == null) {
382            JavacFileManager.preRegister(context);
383            fileManager = context.get(JavaFileManager.class);
384            if (fileManager instanceof BaseFileManager bfm) {
385                bfm.autoClose = true;
386            }
387        }
388
389        // Perform an initial scan of the options to determine the doclet to be
390        // used (if any),
391        // so that it may participate in the main round of option processing.
392        try {
393            doclet = preprocess(options);
394        } catch (ToolException te) {
395            if (!te.result.isOK()) {
396                if (te.message != null) {
397                    log.printError(te.message);
398                }
399                Throwable t = te.getCause();
400                dumpStack(t == null ? te : t);
401            }
402            return te.result;
403        } catch (OptionException oe) {
404            if (oe.message != null) {
405                log.printError(oe.message);
406            }
407            oe.m.run();
408            Throwable t = oe.getCause();
409            dumpStack(t == null ? oe : t);
410            return oe.result;
411        }
412
413        Result result = OK;
414        try {
415            result = parseAndExecute(options, fileObjects);
416        } catch (com.sun.tools.javac.main.Option.InvalidValueException e) {
417            // The detail message from javac already includes a localized
418            // "error: " prefix,
419            // so print the message directly.
420            // It would be even better to rethrow this as
421            // IllegalArgumentException
422            // when invoked via the API.
423            // See javac Arguments.error(InvalidValueException) for an example
424            log.printRawLines(e.getMessage());
425            Throwable t = e.getCause();
426            dumpStack(t == null ? e : t);
427            return ERROR;
428        } catch (OptionException oe) {
429            // It would be even better to rethrow this as
430            // IllegalArgumentException
431            // when invoked via the API.
432            // See javac Arguments.error(InvalidValueException) for an example
433            if (oe.message != null)
434                log.printError(oe.message);
435
436            oe.m.run();
437            Throwable t = oe.getCause();
438            dumpStack(t == null ? oe : t);
439            return oe.result;
440        } catch (ToolException exc) {
441            if (exc.message != null) {
442                log.printError(exc.message);
443            }
444            Throwable t = exc.getCause();
445            if (result == ABNORMAL) {
446                reportInternalError(t == null ? exc : t);
447            } else {
448                dumpStack(t == null ? exc : t);
449            }
450            return exc.result;
451        } catch (OutOfMemoryError ee) {
452            error("main.out.of.memory");
453            result = SYSERR;
454            dumpStack(ee);
455        } catch (ClientCodeException e) {
456            // simply rethrow these exceptions, to be caught and handled by
457            // JavadocTaskImpl
458            throw e;
459        } catch (Error | Exception ee) {
460            error("main.fatal.error", ee);
461            reportInternalError(ee);
462            result = ABNORMAL;
463        } finally {
464            if (fileManager instanceof BaseFileManager bfm
465                && bfm.autoClose) {
466                try {
467                    fileManager.close();
468                } catch (IOException ignore) {
469                }
470            }
471            if (this.options.rejectWarnings() && log.hasWarnings()) {
472                error("main.warnings.Werror");
473            }
474            boolean haveErrors = log.hasErrors();
475            if (!result.isOK() && !haveErrors) {
476                // the doclet failed, but nothing reported, flag it!.
477                error("main.unknown.error");
478            }
479            if (haveErrors && result.isOK()) {
480                result = ERROR;
481            }
482            log.printErrorWarningCounts();
483            log.flush();
484        }
485        return result;
486    }
487
488    private void reportInternalError(Throwable t) {
489        log.printErrorUsingKey("doclet.internal.report.bug");
490        dumpStack(true, t);
491    }
492
493    private void dumpStack(Throwable t) {
494        dumpStack(false, t);
495    }
496
497    private void dumpStack(boolean enabled, Throwable t) {
498        if (t != null && (enabled || options.dumpOnError())) {
499            t.printStackTrace(System.err);
500        }
501    }
502
503    /**
504     * Main program - internal
505     */
506    private Result parseAndExecute(List<String> argList,
507            Iterable<? extends JavaFileObject> fileObjects)
508            throws ToolException, OptionException,
509            com.sun.tools.javac.main.Option.InvalidValueException {
510        final long startNanos = System.nanoTime();
511
512        List<String> javaNames = new ArrayList<>();
513
514        // Make sure no obsolete source/target messages are reported
515        try {
516            options.processCompilerOption(
517                com.sun.tools.javac.main.Option.XLINT_CUSTOM,
518                "-Xlint:-options");
519        } catch (com.sun.tools.javac.main.Option.InvalidValueException ignore) {
520        }
521
522        Arguments arguments = Arguments.instance(context);
523        arguments.init(ProgramName);
524        arguments.allowEmpty();
525
526        doclet.init(locale, log);
527        int beforeCount = log.nerrors;
528        boolean success = parseArgs(argList, javaNames);
529        int afterCount = log.nerrors;
530        if (!success && beforeCount == afterCount) { // if there were failures
531                                                     // but they have not been
532                                                     // reported
533            return CMDERR;
534        }
535
536        if (!arguments.handleReleaseOptions(extra -> true)) {
537            // Arguments does not always increase the error count in the
538            // case of errors, so increment the error count only if it has
539            // not been updated previously, preventing complaints by callers
540            if (!log.hasErrors() && !log.hasWarnings())
541                log.nerrors++;
542            return CMDERR;
543        }
544
545        if (!arguments.validate()) {
546            // Arguments does not always increase the error count in the
547            // case of errors, so increment the error count only if it has
548            // not been updated previously, preventing complaints by callers
549            if (!log.hasErrors() && !log.hasWarnings())
550                log.nerrors++;
551            return CMDERR;
552        }
553
554        if (fileManager instanceof BaseFileManager bfm) {
555            // standard file manager: use direct support for handling options
556            bfm.handleOptions(options.fileManagerOptions());
557        } else {
558            // unrecognized file manager:
559            for (Map.Entry<com.sun.tools.javac.main.Option, String> e : options
560                .fileManagerOptions().entrySet()) {
561                String optName = e.getKey().getPrimaryName();
562                String optValue = e.getValue();
563                try {
564                    if (!fileManager.handleOption(optName,
565                        List.of(optValue).iterator())) {
566                        log.error("main.unknown.option.for.filemanager",
567                            optName);
568                    }
569                } catch (IllegalArgumentException ex) {
570                    log.error("main.bad.arg.for.filemanager.option", optName,
571                        ex.getMessage());
572                }
573            }
574        }
575
576        String mr = com.sun.tools.javac.main.Option.MULTIRELEASE.primaryName;
577        if (fileManager.isSupportedOption(mr) == 1) {
578            Target target = Target.instance(context);
579            List<String> list = List.of(target.multiReleaseValue());
580            fileManager.handleOption(mr, list.iterator());
581        }
582        options.compilerOptions().notifyListeners();
583
584        if (options.modules().isEmpty()) {
585            if (options.subpackages().isEmpty()) {
586                if (javaNames.isEmpty() && isEmpty(fileObjects)) {
587                    String text = log.getText(
588                        "main.No_modules_packages_or_classes_specified");
589                    throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
590                }
591            }
592        }
593
594        JavadocTool comp = JavadocTool.make0(context);
595        if (comp == null)
596            return ABNORMAL;
597
598        DocletEnvironment docEnv
599            = comp.getEnvironment(options, javaNames, fileObjects);
600
601        // release resources
602        comp = null;
603
604        if (options.breakIterator()
605            || !locale.getLanguage().equals(Locale.ENGLISH.getLanguage())) {
606            JavacTrees trees = JavacTrees.instance(context);
607            trees.setBreakIterator(BreakIterator.getSentenceInstance(locale));
608        }
609        // pass off control to the doclet
610        Result returnStatus = docEnv != null && doclet.run(docEnv)
611            ? OK
612            : ERROR;
613
614        // We're done.
615        if (options.verbose()) {
616            long elapsedMillis = (System.nanoTime() - startNanos) / 1_000_000;
617            JavadocLog.printRawLines(log.getDiagnosticWriter(),
618                log.getText("main.done_in", Long.toString(elapsedMillis)));
619        }
620
621        return returnStatus;
622    }
623
624    boolean matches(List<String> names, String arg) {
625        for (String name : names) {
626            if (StringUtils.toLowerCase(name)
627                .equals(StringUtils.toLowerCase(arg)))
628                return true;
629        }
630        return false;
631    }
632
633    boolean matches(Doclet.Option option, String arg) {
634        if (matches(option.getNames(), arg))
635            return true;
636        int sep = arg.indexOf(':');
637        String targ = arg.substring(0, sep + 1);
638        return matches(option.getNames(), targ);
639    }
640
641    private Set<? extends Doclet.Option> docletOptions = null;
642
643    /*
644     * Consumes an option along with its arguments. Returns an advanced index
645     * modulo the sign. If the value is negative, it means there was a failure
646     * processing one or more options.
647     */
648    int consumeDocletOption(int idx, List<String> args, boolean isToolOption)
649            throws OptionException {
650        if (docletOptions == null) {
651            docletOptions = getSupportedOptionsOf(doclet);
652        }
653        String arg = args.get(idx);
654        String argBase, argVal;
655        if (arg.startsWith("--") && arg.contains("=")) {
656            int sep = arg.indexOf("=");
657            argBase = arg.substring(0, sep);
658            argVal = arg.substring(sep + 1);
659        } else {
660            argBase = arg;
661            argVal = null;
662        }
663        int m = 1;
664        String text = null;
665        for (Doclet.Option opt : docletOptions) {
666            if (matches(opt, argBase)) {
667                if (argVal != null) {
668                    switch (opt.getArgumentCount()) {
669                    case 0:
670                        text = log.getText("main.unnecessary_arg_provided",
671                            argBase);
672                        throw new OptionException(ERROR, this::showUsage, text);
673                    case 1:
674                        if (!opt.process(arg, List.of(argVal))) {
675                            m = -1;
676                        }
677                        break;
678                    default:
679                        text = log.getText("main.only_one_argument_with_equals",
680                            argBase);
681                        throw new OptionException(ERROR, this::showUsage, text);
682                    }
683                } else {
684                    if (args.size() - idx - 1 < opt.getArgumentCount()) {
685                        text = log.getText("main.requires_argument", arg);
686                        throw new OptionException(ERROR, this::showUsage, text);
687                    }
688                    if (!opt.process(arg, args.subList(idx + 1,
689                        idx + 1 + opt.getArgumentCount()))) {
690                        m = -1;
691                    }
692                    idx += opt.getArgumentCount();
693                }
694                return m * idx;
695            }
696        }
697        // check if arg is accepted by the tool before emitting error
698        if (!isToolOption) {
699            text = log.getText("main.invalid_flag", arg);
700            throw new OptionException(ERROR, this::showUsage, text);
701        }
702        return m * idx;
703    }
704
705    private static Set<? extends Option> getSupportedOptionsOf(Doclet doclet) {
706        Set<? extends Option> options = doclet.getSupportedOptions();
707        return options == null ? Set.of() : options;
708    }
709
710    /**
711     * Performs an initial pass over the options, primarily to determine
712     * the doclet to be used (if any), so that it may participate in the
713     * main round of option decoding. This avoids having to specify that
714     * the options to specify the doclet should appear before any options
715     * that are handled by the doclet.
716     *
717     * The downside of this initial phase is that we have to skip over
718     * unknown options, and assume that we can reliably detect the options
719     * we need to handle.
720     *
721     * @param argv the arguments to be processed
722     * @return the doclet
723     * @throws ToolException if an error occurs initializing the doclet
724     * @throws OptionException if an error occurs while processing an option
725     */
726    private Doclet preprocess(List<String> argv)
727            throws ToolException, OptionException {
728        // doclet specifying arguments
729        String userDocletPath = null;
730        String userDocletName = null;
731
732        // Step 1: loop through the args, set locale early on, if found.
733        for (int i = 0; i < argv.size(); i++) {
734            String arg = argv.get(i);
735            if (arg.equals(ToolOptions.DUMP_ON_ERROR)) {
736                // although this option is not needed in order to initialize the
737                // doclet,
738                // it is helpful if it is set before trying to initialize the
739                // doclet
740                options.setDumpOnError(true);
741            } else if (arg.equals(ToolOptions.LOCALE)) {
742                checkOneArg(argv, i++);
743                String lname = argv.get(i);
744                locale = getLocale(lname);
745            } else if (arg.equals(ToolOptions.DOCLET)) {
746                checkOneArg(argv, i++);
747                if (userDocletName != null) {
748                    if (apiMode) {
749                        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
750                            "More than one doclet specified (" +
751                                userDocletName + " and " + argv.get(i) + ").");
752                    }
753                    String text = log.getText(
754                        "main.more_than_one_doclet_specified_0_and_1",
755                        userDocletName, argv.get(i));
756                    throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
757                }
758                if (docletName != null) {
759                    if (apiMode) {
760                        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
761                            "More than one doclet specified (" +
762                                docletName + " and " + argv.get(i) + ").");
763                    }
764                    String text = log.getText(
765                        "main.more_than_one_doclet_specified_0_and_1",
766                        docletName, argv.get(i));
767                    throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
768                }
769                userDocletName = argv.get(i);
770            } else if (arg.equals(ToolOptions.DOCLET_PATH)) {
771                checkOneArg(argv, i++);
772                if (userDocletPath == null) {
773                    userDocletPath = argv.get(i);
774                } else {
775                    userDocletPath += File.pathSeparator + argv.get(i);
776                }
777            }
778        }
779
780        // Step 3: doclet name specified ? if so find a ClassLoader,
781        // and load it.
782        if (docletClass == null) {
783            if (userDocletName != null) {
784                ClassLoader cl = classLoader;
785                if (cl == null) {
786                    if (!fileManager.hasLocation(DOCLET_PATH)) {
787                        List<File> paths = new ArrayList<>();
788                        if (userDocletPath != null) {
789                            for (String pathname : userDocletPath
790                                .split(File.pathSeparator)) {
791                                paths.add(new File(pathname));
792                            }
793                        }
794                        try {
795                            ((StandardJavaFileManager) fileManager)
796                                .setLocation(DOCLET_PATH, paths);
797                        } catch (IOException ioe) {
798                            if (apiMode) {
799                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
800                                    "Could not set location for " +
801                                        userDocletPath,
802                                    ioe);
803                            }
804                            String text = log.getText(
805                                "main.doclet_could_not_set_location",
806                                userDocletPath);
807                            throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text, ioe);
808                        }
809                    }
810                    cl = fileManager.getClassLoader(DOCLET_PATH);
811                    if (cl == null) {
812                        // despite doclet specified on cmdline no classloader
813                        // found!
814                        if (apiMode) {
815                            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
816                                "Could not obtain classloader to load "
817
818                                    + userDocletPath);
819                        }
820                        String text
821                            = log.getText("main.doclet_no_classloader_found",
822                                userDocletName);
823                        throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
824                    }
825                }
826                docletClass = loadDocletClass(userDocletName, cl);
827            } else if (docletName != null) {
828                docletClass
829                    = loadDocletClass(docletName, getClass().getClassLoader());
830            } else {
831                docletClass = StandardDoclet.class;
832            }
833        }
834
835        if (Doclet.class.isAssignableFrom(docletClass)) {
836            log.setLocale(Locale.getDefault());  // use default locale for
837                                                 // console messages
838            try {
839                Object o = docletClass.getConstructor().newInstance();
840                doclet = (Doclet) o;
841            } catch (ReflectiveOperationException exc) {
842                if (apiMode) {
843                    throw new ClientCodeException(exc);
844                }
845                String text = log.getText("main.could_not_instantiate_class",
846                    docletClass.getName());
847                throw new ToolException(ERROR, text);
848            }
849        } else {
850            String text
851                = log.getText("main.not_a_doclet", docletClass.getName());
852            throw new ToolException(ERROR, text);
853        }
854        return doclet;
855    }
856
857    private Class<?> loadDocletClass(String docletName, ClassLoader classLoader)
858            throws ToolException {
859        try {
860            return classLoader == null ? Class.forName(docletName)
861                : classLoader.loadClass(docletName);
862        } catch (ClassNotFoundException cnfe) {
863            if (apiMode) {
864                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
865                    "Cannot find doclet class " + docletName);
866            }
867            String text
868                = log.getText("main.doclet_class_not_found", docletName);
869            throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text, cnfe);
870        }
871    }
872
873    private boolean parseArgs(List<String> args, List<String> javaNames)
874            throws OptionException,
875            com.sun.tools.javac.main.Option.InvalidValueException {
876        boolean success = true;
877        for (int i = 0; i < args.size(); i++) {
878            String arg = args.get(i);
879            ToolOption o = options.getOption(arg);
880            if (o != null) {
881                // handle a doclet argument that may be needed however
882                // don't increment the index, and allow the tool to consume args
883                if (consumeDocletOption(i, args, true) < 0) {
884                    success = false;
885                }
886                if (o.hasArg) {
887                    if (arg.startsWith("--") && arg.contains("=")) {
888                        o.process(arg.substring(arg.indexOf('=') + 1));
889                    } else {
890                        checkOneArg(args, i++);
891                        o.process(args.get(i));
892                    }
893                } else if (o.hasSuffix) {
894                    o.process(arg);
895                } else {
896                    o.process();
897                }
898            } else if (arg.startsWith("-XD")) {
899                // hidden javac options
900                String s = arg.substring("-XD".length());
901                int eq = s.indexOf('=');
902                String key = (eq < 0) ? s : s.substring(0, eq);
903                String value = (eq < 0) ? s : s.substring(eq + 1);
904                options.compilerOptions().put(key, value);
905            } else if (arg.startsWith("-")) {
906                i = consumeDocletOption(i, args, false);
907                if (i < 0) {
908                    i = -i;
909                    success = false;
910                }
911            } else {
912                javaNames.add(arg);
913            }
914        }
915        return success;
916    }
917
918    private <T> boolean isEmpty(Iterable<T> iter) {
919        return !iter.iterator().hasNext();
920    }
921
922    /**
923     * Check the one arg option.
924     * Error and exit if one argument is not provided.
925     */
926    private void checkOneArg(List<String> args, int index)
927            throws OptionException {
928        if ((index + 1) >= args.size()
929            || args.get(index + 1).startsWith("-d")) {
930            String text
931                = log.getText("main.requires_argument", args.get(index));
932            throw new OptionException(CMDERR, this::showUsage, text);
933        }
934    }
935
936    void error(String key, Object... args) {
937        log.printErrorUsingKey(key, args);
938    }
939
940    /**
941     * Get the locale if specified on the command line
942     * else return null and if locale option is not used
943     * then return default locale.
944     */
945    private Locale getLocale(String localeName) throws ToolException {
946        try {
947            // Tolerate, at least for a while, the older syntax accepted by
948            // javadoc,
949            // using _ as the separator
950            localeName = localeName.replace("_", "-");
951            Locale l = new Locale.Builder().setLanguageTag(localeName).build();
952            // Ensure that a non-empty language is available for the <HTML
953            // lang=...> element
954            return (l.getLanguage().isEmpty()) ? Locale.ENGLISH : l;
955        } catch (IllformedLocaleException e) {
956            String text = log.getText("main.malformed_locale_name", localeName);
957            throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
958        }
959    }
960
961}
